vector< CovarianceFunction * > covFunctions

Detailed Description

Sum of covariance functions. This allows to build complex covariance functions using a mixture of basic ones.

Definition at line 204 of file SumCF.cpp.

References covFunctions, and reindex().

double SumCF::getParameter ( const int  p  )  const [virtual]

Get a given parameter (out of the parameters from all covariance functions)

Parameters:
p the parameter number, between 0 and the total number of parameters
Returns:
Note:
parameters are indexed in the order in which the covariance functions are added to the sum, i.e. for a sum of 2 covariance functions, each with 3 parameters, parameters 0-2 correspond to the parameters of the 1st covariance function, and parameters 3-5 correspond to those of the second covariance function.
See also:
reindex

Reimplemented from CovarianceFunction.

void SumCF::displayCovarianceParameters ( int  nspaces = 0  )  const [virtual]

Display information about the current parameters of the covariance functions. This can be indented by an optional number of space characters (useful for mixtures of nested covariance functions).

Parameters:
nspaces Number of space characters to indent by.

Reimplemented from CovarianceFunction.
